page.title: 05River Medway Part 2
page.content: { continued from page 4 Before they close the barrier they have to warn the Police, the County Council, the N.F.U. and Lord De L'Isle's farm manager. They give them 12 hours warning. They can tell how high the water is getting because they have computers and a control room at Leigh. There are three gates in the barrier,and two are generally shut. There is a big embankment of 1Km to stop the flood water spilling over onto the Tonbridge side. There is a railway track nearby and they had to build a high bank called a{berm}to protect the railway track.
